subject: Medicine
title: Platelets and Clotting
description: A quick, practical guide to Platelets and Clotting.

hook.text: When you cut yourself, bleeding usually stops in minutes.

buildup.text: Tiny cell fragments called platelets rush to the wound.

discovery.text: They stick together and form a plug over the opening.

twist.text: A protein mesh called fibrin then weaves over the plug.

climax.text: The clot hardens into a scab that protects healing tissue.

punchline.text: Your blood builds its own bandage.

quiz.question: What forms the mesh that strengthens a blood clot?
